data.taskTitle: Migrate skeleton components to DaisyUI classes
Migrate skeleton components to DaisyUI classes
data.approach: Replace ~100 hardcoded oklch colors with DaisyUI semantic classes (bg-base-100, bg-base-200, bg-base-300, border-base-content/20, etc.) across 10 skeleton components. This ensures proper theme switching support.

data.taskTitle: Migrate skeleton components to DaisyUI classes
Migrate skeleton components to DaisyUI classes
Migrate skeleton components to DaisyUI classes

summary: Converted 10 skeleton components from hardcoded oklch colors to DaisyUI semantic classes
Replaced ~100 inline style declarations with theme-aware utility classes
All skeletons now properly respect light/dark theme switching

quality.preExisting: TypeScript errors in other files are pre-existing and unrelated

suggestedTasks.title: Add visual regression tests for skeleton components
suggestedTasks.description: Screenshot comparison tests to verify skeleton appearance across different DaisyUI themes (light, dark, nord, etc.)
suggestedTasks.reason: No automated visual testing exists for skeleton loading states

suggestedTasks.title: Document DaisyUI color mapping conventions
suggestedTasks.description: Add section to CLAUDE.md documenting the oklch to DaisyUI class mapping pattern used in skeleton components
suggestedTasks.reason: Pattern should be documented for future component work

patterns: Use bg-base-100/200/300 for layered backgrounds (darker number = darker shade)
Use bg-base-content/10-15 for skeleton placeholder elements
Use bg-primary/XX, bg-warning/XX, bg-success/XX for semantic accents
gotchas: Tailwind opacity modifiers like bg-base-content/12 work but may not be in autocomplete
Some skeleton files have animations defined in <style> blocks that should be preserved
